meaning: Incapable of producing any useful result; pointless.
sentences:
It would be futile to protest
Trying to please other people is largely a futile activity.

meaning: a typical example or pattern of something; a pattern or model.
sentences:
This episode may serve as a paradigm.
 The war was a paradigm of the evil and destructive side of human nature.

meaning: satisfy (one's thirst) by drinking.
sentences:
Wine in the bottle does not quench thirst.
The firemen were unable to quench the fire.

meaning: a momentary or partial view.
sentences: I caught a glimpse of our new neighbor.

meaning: lasting for a very short time.
sentences: Life is short and time is fleeting.

meaning: be of the same opinion; agree.
sentences: I strongly concur with that idea

meaning: awkward in movement or in handling things. done awkwardly or without skill. difficult to handle or use; unwieldy. lacking social skills; tactless.
sentences:
He is clumsy with tools.
He is so clumsy that he cant even push the small cart ahead.

meaning: the ability to understand and share the feelings of another.
sentences: She had great empathy with people.

meaning: sympathetic pity and concern for the sufferings or misfortunes of others.
sentences: I was hoping she might show a little compassion.

meaning: absorb or assimilate (ideas or knowledge).
sentences: These plants imbibe moisture through their roots.

meaning: a future event or circumstance which is possible but cannot be predicted with certainty. a provision for a possible event or circumstance.
sentences:
Have you made any contingency plans?
A fire in our warehouse was a contingency that we had not expected.

meaning: completely; totally.
sentences:
I stopped seeing her altogether
Altogether there were 38 people in the bus.

meaning: squeeze or constrict the neck of (a person or animal), especially so as to cause death. hamper or hinder the development or activity of.
sentences: He tried to strangle a border policeman and steal his gun.

meaning: a  person who watches at a show, game, or other event.
sentences: A spectator threw the ball back to the players.

meaning: an act of armed resistance to an established government or leader.
sentences:
Oppression provoked the people to rebellion.
the new government quickly suppressed the rebellion.

meaning: make (someone) unable to breathe properly; suffocate. restrain (a reaction) or stop oneself acting on (an emotion).
sentences: She managed to stifle a yawn.

meaning: extremely thorough and careful. strictly applied or adhered to.
sentences:
The planes have to undergo rigorous safety checks.
The ship is still in rigorous quarantine.

meaning: imitate (someone or their actions or words), especially in order to entertain or ridicule.
sentences: He could mimic all the teachers accents.

meaning: destroy completely; put an end to.

sentences:
We can eradicate this disease from the world.
We are determined to eradicate racism from our sport.

meaning: 1. a member of a self-appointed group of citizens who undertake law enforcement in their community without legal authority, typically because the legal agencies are thought to be inadequate.
sentences: The vigilantes dragged the men out of the vehicles.

meaning: a sum paid for killing or capturing a person or animal. a sum paid by the state to encourage trade.
sentences:
They paid a $ 5 bounty for dogs.
A bounty of $10 000 has been offered for the capture of his murderer.

meaning: formally put an end to
sentences: Some MPs want to abolish the tax altogether.

meaning: an unintended consequence of an event or action, especially an unwelcome one.
sentences:
What repercussions will the war have on the economy?
Any decrease in tourism could have serious repercussions for the local economy.

meaning: requiring considerable time and effort.
sentences: Collecting the raw materials proved a long and laborious task.

meaning: sleepy and lethargic; half asleep.
sentences:
I feel drowsy after lunch every day.
Id just woken up and was still drowsy.

meaning: protect and care for (someone) lovingly.
sentences: I will cherish all tne memories of us together!

meaning: magnificent; very impressive. excellent; very good.
sentences: The fireworks looked very splendid against the dark sky.

meaning: disturbance or problems which interrupt an event, activity, or process. radical change to an existing industry or market due to technological innovation.
sentences: Strikes are causing severe disruption to all train services.

meaning: the health, happiness, and fortunes of a person or group.
sentences: Our only concern is the childrens welfare.

meaning: prepare and use (land) for crops or gardening. raise or grow (plants), especially on a large scale for commercial purposes.
sentences: The land was too rocky to cultivate.

meaning: (especially of an animal) unable to walk without difficulty as the result of an injury or illness affecting the leg or foot.  uninspiring and dull.

He is lame in the right leg.
She gave some lame excuse about missing the bus.

meaning: of only average quality; not very good.
sentences: His films are mediocre.

meaning: dependent on someone or something.
sentences: The hostel is heavily reliant upon charity.

meaning: hold (someone) closely in one's arms, especially as a sign of affection.
sentences:
I just want a warm embrace and nothing more.

meaning: the extreme edge of land before a steep slope or a body or water.

The tree grew on the brink of the cliff.
The company is on the brink of bankruptcy.

meaning: extreme scarcity of food.
sentences: More die by food than by famine

meaning: force or oblige (someone) to do something. force to come or go in a particular direction.
sentences: The law will compel employers to provide health insurance.

meaning: nothing other than; unmitigated (used for emphasis).

meaning: render (something) poorer in quality by adding another substance.

meaning: careful and persistent work or effort.
sentences:

Diligence is the mother of success.

meaning: impossible to believe. difficult to believe; extraordinary.
sentences: The view is just incredible.

meaning: huge; enormous.

They have a humongous dog.
An active galaxy is a star system with a humongous black hole at its centre.

meaning: an event causing great and usually sudden damage or suffering; a disaster.

meaning: please (someone) greatly. take great pleasure in.
sentences: The kids were screaming with delight.

meaning: see or observe (someone or something, especially of remarkable or impressive nature).

We got up early to behold the sunrise.
Behold, the new king is crowned.

meaning: a long, high-pitched cry or noise.
sentences: I heard a girl squeal in that room.

meaning: a check or restraint on something.
sentences: She put a curb on her spending.

meaning: the process of training or accustoming a person or animal to behave in a certain way or to accept certain circumstances.
sentences: Social conditioning makes crying more difficult for men.

meaning: different to what is normal or expected; strange.

meaning: relating to meteors or meteorites.

meaning: stay in a place longer than necessary because of a reluctance to leave. spend a long time over (something).

meaning: be heavier, greater, or more significant than.

meaning: induce (someone) to do something through reasoning or argument.

meaning: a projection or shelter that resembles a roof. an ornamental cloth covering hung or held up over something, especially a throne or bed.

meaning: withdraw from enemy forces as a result of their superior power or after a defeat. move back or withdraw. move (a piece) back from a forward or threatened position on the board.

A brave retreat is a brave exploit.

meaning: Wage a war

meaning: a ceremonial chair for a sovereign, bishop, or similar figure.

meaning: regard as probable; expect or predict. guess or be aware of (what will happen) and take action in order to be prepared.

Mum tried to anticipate all my needs.
We dont anticipate any trouble.

meaning: of a sharp pointed object) go into or through (something). make (a hole) with a sharp instrument.make an opening in or bore a tunnel through.

meaning: 1. a fault-bounded area or region with a distinctive stratigraphy, structure, and geological history.

meaning: having the characteristics of a hero or heroine; admirably brave or determined.

meaning: the state or quality of being ferocious. savagely fierce, cruel, or violent.

meaning: to a great degree; in large amounts.

meaning: surprise or impress (someone) greatly.

meaning: the killing or wounding of people, typically on a large scale during a conflict.

meaning: a person or group competing with others to achieve something.

meaning: accept or act in accordance with (a rule, decision, or recommendation). be unable to tolerate (someone or something).
